title: Crystalline Materials Analysis Using Compact and Powerful SEM-EBSD System
content: Scanning Electron Microscope-Electron Backscatter Diffraction (SEM-EBSD) is a method used to determine the individual grain orientations in bulk polycrystalline materials. It is widely employed for tasks such as grain size distribution analysis, strain visualization, and more. Due to these capabilities, SEM-EBSD has become integral to research in metallurgy and mineralogy, encompassing fields such as steel and ceramics [1].
